summary: Advance notice of next regular scheduled maintenance day

updates.details: Advance notice of scheduled maintenance day on Tues 11 November 2025. Please plan your work to minimise disruption.

summary: Server nx4.jasmin.ac.uk down to test new configuration.

updates.details: Server nx4 is currently down to test a new configuration. Other NX servers nx1 - nx3 available as normal.
Server nx4 still out of service. nx1.jasmin being investigated for connection problems. nx2 and nx3 should be available as normal.
Issue reported, under investigation with storage vendor.
Intervention planned for 10:15 this morning (Thurs 21 Aug), may result in affected storage being offline for a few minutes.
Further issues over the long weekend: rollout of changes from 21 Aug took time to reach some nodes. Storage cluster is now improving.

summary: Some LOTUS jobs delayed or failed

updates.details: Many nodes drained overnight; users' jobs may have failed or be queued up. Cause under investigation.
Now confirmed as related to PFS storage performance issue, so expected to continue until resolved, with some jobs expected to fail & require resubmission.

Many LOTUS hosts down after storage-related problems over the weekend. Remedial work in progress. Please AVOID polling the Slurm controller with sinfo, squeue etc. for now as this helps reduce load while it is recovering.

Cluster is improving but to help recovery, partitions will be put into down state this evening 19:00, meaning jobs can still be submitted but will not run until a further intervention tomorrow. If possible, please postpone further job submissions until further notice, check here for updates.
Cluster is continuing to improve so partitions will NOW now be put in down state overnight: jobs should continue running however some job failures may still be possible.

summary: Reboots required to clear performance issues

updates.details: The sci-vm-* servers will be rebooted between 15:30 - 16:00 today to clear current performance issues.
Advance notice of two planned network outages at the RAL site: Wed 27 Aug (07:00-08:00) and Wed 03 Sep (07:00-08:00). Please plan your work to minimise disruption.
A build-up of stuck processes on transfer nodes necessitates reboots this morning. Delayed transfers should resume automatically.
Affected nodes now rebooted. Delayed transfers should resume automatically.
